content:
Minor changes to the text in the Goal section:
1. "in no more than two days" becomes "in two days" to remove the ambiguity. ("No more than two" can mean "one" or even "half", etc.)
2. Similarly, "you do not think that will take more than four days" becomes "you think that will take just four days".
3. "teleport" becomes "teleports" (grammar).
4. "two others" becomes "other two".
5. "make you save some time" becomes "save you some time".
6. "those spot" becomes "those spots" (grammar).
7. "pass trough" becomes "pass through" (spelling).
8. "pass there again" becomes "passing there again" (grammar issue).
9. "each time you you will come home" becomes "each time you return home" (mainly to remove the duplicated "you").
Added "write answer" to stub generator.
At the author's request (see the logs of #fr), I have removed the dead link to the spotify playlist.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is high quality contribution with great story and nice challenge.
Both reading and solving it was fun.

I like it but I've obviously failed the reading comprehension because I can't even figure out how to solve the first test case by hand and reach 9 for the first test case.  Without having an idea of how to go about solving the first test case I can't solve this, but i'd like to.  For example, I'm unsure if moving through grassland is 0,1 or 2 day, or always 2 days ("no more than two days" is in the description).  And does that mean you can cross all the grassland in 2 days, but 1 tile of grassland in 1 day.
Fixed the stub generator code. I was using "loopline" instead of "loop". Thanks to Alshock for the report.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice attempt to bring a new format of puzzle on CG.
I have replaced "type" with "kind" in the input section and the stub.

I made some changes and corrections in the statement, passed the O string on a separate line in the input format, and added a test case.
Thanks to Stilgart for his feedback.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It was fun to solve. I loved the proposed music to listen to while solving the puzzle.
Meh... Since nobody complain, I reset it to ready. ^^
OK. I try something totally different for the statement, so tell me what do you think... :3
Very nice challenge! I only have a partial solution but I find it awesome  :)

After a discussion on the chat, I want to make big changes on the statement shape. But I have an issue about the char limit of the statement, which is supposed to have been increased to 5K, but is still of 3K. Moreover, this new version will probably need some adjustments. So I set back the contribution to WIP. ^^

I have not solved it yet, but here are some questions I asked myself while reading the statement:
- Are there at most one point of interest by type?
- In case the closest point of interest is an act of bravery, where the wizard will teleport us once the said act of bravery is done?
- Can we reuse the wizard ability? (I guess we cannot reuse the blacksmith or the stable, and it can simply be seen as a grassland after the first use.)

I may answer those questions myself if I read the proposed solution. However, I prefer to solve it first before reading that solution.

It was fun listening to the music while reading the statement and the test cases ^^.
I added a test case. And since nobody noticed any issues, I publish the puzzle. ;)

I suggest the following changes:
* peasant -> dev
* hero -> CG staff
* realm -> quest map
* point of interest ->achievement
* act of bravery -> help noobs solving Temperatures, ...

Hey there !
I'll possibly add new test cases.
I'm waiting for your feedback.

Thanks for the feedback ! I'm glad that you appreciated the "musical concept". ^^
Now about your questions:
- There is no more than one point of interest of each type. I will edit the statement to make that clearer.
- Even done, the location of an act of bravery stay a point of interest. I will also precise that.
- About the wizard, I think this point is clear enough and comes under "reading comprehension". ^^ I mean, you can't cumulate more than one stable's bonus because you can't ride two horses, and  more than one blacksmith's bonus  'cause you can't wear two equipments. But no problem of this type for teleportation...

EDIT: Statement modified.
Ooops, sorry, I didn't increase the limit client-side. It should be possible now.
Thanks ! ;)
Woops ! Totally forgot to change that. Thanks !
"No more than two days" stand for "two days", it's just to vary formulations a little. Is this really misleading? You're the first one to tell me about this one.
Just one thing: it was unclear that a horse improves your speed when crossing water, as story previosly states that you go by boat.
Hey... Yes. Story was modified multiple times, and I missed that... I will find something to clarify. Thanks for validating !
Done "And a stable, where you can buy a horse to travel twice as fast, even on water since the horse can pulls the boat."

can pull*

I have fixed it and a couple of other typos.

I'll take another look.  So, is the first one solved like so
1 day to leave mom, 2 days for field @[1,3], 4 days for princess @[2,2], 2 days for field @[3,1], then castle is free and done?  For some reason I thought you HAD to have the sword to free the princess and traveling through the princess square with the sword took 4 days.  Okay, I think I get it now.
I love the write up, and I don't have an issue with the write up length since the programming challenge is "hard", and hard usually means several hours of coding for me.
Cool ! :)
Oh good. I will try.
